headline: Tevra Brands Expands Pet Wellness Reach with National Walmart Launch of Vetality Products
summary: Tevra Brands, a leading innovator in pet health and wellness solutions, is proud to announce the national launch of a comprehensive lineup of its Vetality™ products in Walmart stores beginning August 2025. This strategic rollout supports Walmart's continued expansion of its pet wellness aisle, bringing affordable, science-backed solutions to pet parents nationwide.

headline: Trump tariffs hit India's garment makers as US buyers say move production
summary: MUMBAI/CHENNAI (Reuters) -Ever since Donald Trump's tariff salvo on India this week, garment maker Pearl Global - whose U.S. client list includes Gap and Kohl's - has been receiving midnight panic calls with an ultimatum: share the tariff hit or move production out of India.  To calm U.S. customers' nerves, Pearl Global has offered to shift production to its 17 factories in Bangladesh, Indonesia, Vietnam and Guatemala to bypass the steep U.S. levies on Indian imports.

To calm U.S. customers' nerves, Pearl Global has offered to shift production to its 17 factories in Bangladesh, Indonesia, Vietnam and Guatemala to bypass the steep U.S. levies on Indian imports.

headline: Más+ by Messi® Adds "Greatest Grape" Flavor to its Everyday Hydration Beverage Portfolio
summary: The G.O.A.T just got greater. Today, the Leo Messi co-founded hydration beverage Más+ by Messi® is expanding its lineup with the launch of Greatest Grape. The new flavor innovation features a fresh, fruity taste with a sweet grape aroma and has a breakthrough blend of electrolytes, minerals, vitamins1 and antioxidants, perfect for everyday hydration needs.

headline: Maersk boosts profit outlook as container demand defies trade fears
summary: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -Shipping group Maersk raised its full-year profit forecast on Thursday as robust global container demand defied fears that tariffs would hit trade, although the company predicted a slowdown later this year.  Maersk, viewed as a barometer of world trade, said it now expected global container volumes to increase by 2% to 4% this year, compared with a range of down 1% to up 4% estimated in May. The new range implies lower second-half growth, it said.  A drop in U.S. imports after President Donald Trump unleashed a barrage of tariffs on foreign goods "was more than offset" by strong growth in imports into other regions, including Europe, the Danish firm said in its second-quarter earnings statement.

raw.headline: Maersk boosts profit outlook as container demand defies trade fears
raw.summary: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -Shipping group Maersk raised its full-year profit forecast on Thursday as robust global container demand defied fears that tariffs would hit trade, although the company predicted a slowdown later this year. The new range implies lower second-half growth, it said.  A drop in U.S. imports after President Donald Trump unleashed a barrage of tariffs on foreign goods "was more than offset" by strong growth in imports into other regions, including Europe, the Danish firm said in its second-quarter earnings statement.

headline: 1 Cash-Burning Stock Worth Your Attention and 2 We Turn Down
